config.question: John Kerry’s __________ helped him become the 2004 Democrat presidential candidate instead of Howard Dean.

choices.content: initial support of the Iraq war and his record as a Vietnam veteran
superior use of the Internet to connect with voters and drum up support
opposition to health care and increased taxation and social programs
determination to end the Iraq war and bring the troops back home

answer_3.response: Senator John Kerry of Massachusetts was a decorated Vietnam War veteran who had voted for the war but later criticized Bush for misleading the country regarding the causes of the conflict, and who contended that the war in Iraq, rather than contributing to the war on terror, actually distracted from it.
